meanings.definition: To bring a meeting to order by striking a gavel.
meanings.sent1: The mayor gaveling the town hall meeting made everyone quiet down.
meanings.sent2: The judge gavels the court to begin the trial.
meanings.sent3: The teacher gaveling the class to start the lesson accidentally hit the desk too hard.
meanings.sent4: The conductor gaveling the orchestra with his baton set the tempo for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The principal gaveling the assembly reminded students to listen attentively.

meanings.definition: The act of using a gavel to signal the start or end of a meeting.
meanings.sent1: The loud sound of the gaveling echoed through the conference room.
meanings.sent2: The gaveling at the auction indicated the beginning of bidding.
meanings.sent3: The tiny gaveling used in the mock trial amused the students.
meanings.sent4: The final gaveling at the council meeting marked the conclusion of the session.
meanings.sent5: The antique gaveling displayed in the museum was once used by a famous judge.
